The claim states that in Mexico: every eligible Mexican citizen must have a tamper-proof photo-ID card with a thumbprint and an embossed hologram to vote.
The expert: s verdict mentions that Texan Sid Miller posted a meme on his Facebook page defending the Texas voter identification law, which requires voters to present government-issued photo identification.
The meme displayed on Miller: s page shows what appears to be a voter registration card issued by Mexico, stating the requirement for a tamper-proof photo-ID card with a thumbprint and an embossed hologram.
The expert also mentions that Mexico: s government does issue voter IDs featuring each voter's photo and personal information, and that a former state representative brought one of these voter cards from Mexico to a news interview to demonstrate their existence and requirement for voting.
